headline: Charter Prices $3.0 Billion Senior Unsecured Notes
summary: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHTR) (along with its subsidiaries, "Charter") today announced that its subsidiaries, CCO Holdings, LLC ("CCO Holdings") and CCO Holdings Capital Corp. ("CCO Holdings Capital," and together with CCO Holdings, the "Issuers"), have priced $3.0 billion in aggregate principal amount of senior unsecured notes consisting of the following securities:

headline: A Look At Charter Communications (CHTR) Valuation After Recent Senior Unsecured Notes Issuance
summary: Charter Communications (CHTR) has drawn fresh attention after issuing senior unsecured notes totaling US$3b. Management indicated that proceeds will go toward general corporate purposes, upcoming debt redemptions, and potential share repurchases. See our latest analysis for Charter Communications. Those new senior unsecured notes land at a time when the share price has been volatile. A 30 day share price return of 2.69% contrasts with a 90 day share price return of a 23.23% decline and a 1...
